page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content: The village of Burton Lazars is situated two miles to the South of Melton Mowbray centre on the Oakham road.Burton is on a hill with undulating surrounding landscape.The houses are in a group with old and new mixed together including the church, Burton Hall flats and the Manor House. On Cross Lane the houses are nearly all post-1945.The River Eye runs along the Northern edge of the Parish partly beyond our area and Burton Brook runs South _ East of the village and a spring surfaces in the village.There are small woods around with pheasant shooting.West of the village are the remains of a Leper Hospital with moats and ponds.The soil is mainly heavy with isolated pockets of sand.The land is mostly arable with some grassland to the North and West.
